subject: Art
title: Size & Scale
description: How relative size creates importance and establishes relationships.

hook.text: On a movie poster, the main character's face is huge. The villain is smaller. The city skyline is tiny. Size tells you who matters most ‚Äî it's hierarchy at its most primal.

buildup.text: Larger elements feel more important and closer. Smaller elements feel less important and farther away. Size variation creates visual interest ‚Äî a composition of same-sized elements feels monotonous.

discovery.text: The ratio matters: a 3:1 size difference is dynamic and clear. A 1.2:1 difference is ambiguous ‚Äî the viewer can't tell which is meant to be bigger. Go bold with size contrasts.

twist.text: Unexpected scale creates intrigue. A tiny person next to a massive object inspires awe. A giant object filling the frame creates intimacy or threat. Scale manipulation is emotional storytelling.

climax.text: In your next composition, make the main element at least 3x larger than supporting elements. Notice how the hierarchy becomes instantly clear compared to same-sized elements.

punchline.text: Big means important. Small means supporting. Size is hierarchy's loudest voice.

quiz.question: What size ratio between primary and secondary elements creates clear hierarchy?
